Scottland Donaldson

Scottland is a front-end web developer whose clients have included nonprofits, progressive political organizations, and higher education. His interests are in responsive web interfaces, architecture, 3D visualization, and his two rabbits, Humphrey & Martin.

The easiest way to get in touch is with an .

Projects

I Will Vote

with Democratic National Committee

Redeveloped the front-end of a Rails voter registration app in order to reduce dependencies on third-party libraries and optimize client-side performance.

Invisibilities

Freelance

Data visualization using the Wikipedia API and Snap.svg.

Post: Building the Invisibilities Visualization

Voting Rights Matter

with Democratic National Committee

Designed and developed website (static site using Jekyll) on history of voting rights, integrating with Blue State Digital to encourage online organizing.

Books@Work

with Parsley & Sprouts Web Design + Development

Developed website for a nonprofit with custom in-browser SVG animations and integration with Mozilla Open Badges.

Points in Flux

Personal Project

Web game made using p5.js. Move all the points into the shaded region using your mouse or finger.

Martin.js

Personal Project

Developing HTML5 <canvas> library for in-browser photo editing, drawing, and visualization.
